textBox.richText: This last week I spent 3 days in Banff, Canada to speak at the 7th International Workshop on Nanomechanical Cantilever Sensors. I flew into Calgary Tuesday night and drove nearly 2 hours to Banff, arriving after midnight. This was my first visit to the area, which is stunningly beautiful. The town is set in a valley in the Rocky Mountains surrounded by tall, steep mountains covered with forest. Unfortunately, the weather was wet, cold, and cloudy so I wasn’t able to get a clear view most of the time. Thursday morning I got up early and did a 5 mile run in the rain. The next morning I did a 7-8 mile run except it was actually snowing. Pretty strange running in the snow at the end of May! Some pictures from the trip are at the link below. 2010 Banff Photos
